hero.title: Welcome to PrivateAIM
hero.subtitle: Advancing medical research through privacy-preserving analytics

intro.paragraph1: Medical data analysis is crucial in advancing healthcare research, enabling more precise diagnoses, innovative treatments, and future-ready patient care. However, due to the sensitivity of such data, strict privacy safeguards are essential to comply with legal regulations and protect patient confidentiality.
intro.paragraph2: This challenge is particularly evident in Artificial Intelligence (AI) medical applications, where large-scale datasets are required to achieve reliable and meaningful results.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.paragraph1: PrivateAIM (Privacy-preserving Analytics in Medicine) is dedicated to bridging the gap between data privacy and medical innovation. Following the "Code to Data" principle, we ensure that patient data remains securely stored within university hospitals, while only analysis algorithms are exchanged.
mission.paragraph2: This federated approach guarantees that sensitive medical information never leaves its protected environment, safeguarding patient identities at all times.
mission.paragraph3: FLAME (Federated Learning and Analysis in Medicine) is at the heart of our initiative. It is a novel software platform designed to enable secure, decentralized data analysis within the Medical Informatics Initiative (MII).

howItWorks.title: How It Works

step1.title: Data Remains Local
step1.description: Patient data stays secure within hospital systems, never leaving its protected environment.

step2.title: Code to Data Approach
step2.description: Analysis algorithms travel to the data instead of moving sensitive information.

step3.title: Federated Analysis
step3.description: Results are aggregated across institutions while preserving privacy and enhancing research quality.

howItWorks.flamePlatform: Our innovative platform for secure, federated medical data analysis

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.paragraph1: We envision a future where AI-driven medical research is seamlessly integrated with privacy-by-design principles. PrivateAIM is pioneering a new standard for secure, federated medical AI by fostering a collaborative network of hospitals, researchers, and patients.
vision.paragraph2: PrivateAIM actively involves patients, [partners](/partners:internal), and the public through workshops, educational materials, and open dialogue to ensure broad acceptance and transparency. We aim to demystify AI and federated learning, making all security guarantees and benefits understandable.
vision.paragraph3: Over the project time, PrivateAIM and [FLAME](https://docs.privateaim.net:external) will provide the [MII](https://www.medizininformatik-initiative.de/de/start:external) with a secure and scalable solution for cross-institutional medical data analysis. We are shaping the future of trustworthy and impactful medical research by enabling AI-driven healthcare innovations while preserving patient privacy.
vision.explanation: Explore our code repositories and contribute to the future of privacy-preserving medical data research.

cta.title: Ready to Transform Medical Research?
cta.subtitle: Join us in building a future where privacy and innovation go hand in hand.

news.description: Here you can find latest news and updates related PrivateAIM.

information.department: Translational Research Unit of the Charité - Universitätsmedizin Berlin

contact.title: Contact

content.title: Accountability for content
content.text: The contents of our pages have been created with the utmost care. However, we cannot guarantee the contents' accuracy, completeness or topicality. According to statutory provisions, we are furthermore responsible for our own content on these web pages. In this matter, please note that we are not obliged to monitor the transmitted or saved information of third parties, or investigate circumstances pointing to illegal activity. Our obligations to remove or block the use of information under generally applicable laws remain unaffected by this as per §§ 8 to 10 of the Telemedia Act (TMG).

links.title: Accountability for links
links.text: Responsibility for the content of external links (to web pages of third parties) lies solely with the operators of the linked pages. No violations were evident to us at the time of linking. Should any legal infringement become known to us, we will remove the respective link immediately.

copyright.title: Copyright
copyright.text: Our web pages and their contents are subject to German copyright law. Unless expressly permitted by law, every form of utilizing, reproducing or processing works subject to copyright protection on our web pages requires the prior consent of the respective owner of the rights. Individual reproductions of a work are only allowed for private use. The materials from these pages are copyrighted and any unauthorized use may violate copyright laws.

partners.title: Our partners
partners.description:
The PrivateAIM project involves a total of 17 partners from all four consortia of the Medical Informatics Initiative (MII). Three MII-funded junior research groups are also involved. The project is coordinated by the University Hospital of Tübingen, the Berlin Institute of Health at the Charité and the Technical University of Munich.

Here you will find a list of participating universities and research institutes:

network.title: Join Our Network
network.subtitle: Interested in collaborating with PrivateAIM? We're always looking to expand our network of partners who share our vision of privacy-preserving medical research.

box1.title: Access to Cutting-Edge Technology
box1.text: Work with our team to implement state-of-the-art federated learning systems.

box2.title: Collaborative Research Opportunities
box2.text: Participate in multi-institutional studies without compromising data sovereignty.

box3.title: Shape the Future of Medical Research
box3.text: Help define standards and best practices for privacy-preserving analytics.

cookie.title: Cookie Settings
cookie.subtitle: This website uses cookies to improve your browsing experience and to perform analyses of website usage. You can choose which cookies you want to allow.

required.title: Necessary Cookies
required.description: These cookies are essential for the website to function and cannot be disabled.

analysis.title: Analysis Cookies
analysis.description: These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources anonymously, so we can measure and improve the performance of our website.

news.title: News
news.subtitle: Here you will find an overview of the latest news in the context of PrivateAIM.
news.noItems: No news items available for this year.

2025.title: Retreat in Bad Urach
2025.content:
From October 8–10, 2025, the PrivateAIM consortium gathered in Bad Urach for the annual fall project retreat. The meeting opened with the participation of our project funder, who received a demonstration of the current platform and updates from all work packages.
Throughout the retreat, the work packages aligned their activities, finalized preparations for the productive deployment of the FLAME platform, and discussed upcoming use cases at the first deployed university hospitals. The focused exchange and collaborative atmosphere provided a strong foundation for the next project phase.

2025.title: GMDS 2025
2025.content: At GMDS 2025 in Jena, Dr. Marius de Arruda Botelho Herr and Peter Placzek presented the FLAME architecture and its policy framework. The workshop highlights how FLAME integrates privacy-enhancing technologies with a dynamic policy framework to address regulatory and technical challenges, while enabling secure, scalable collaboration across institutions View the presentation

2025.title: Retreat in Herrsching
2025.content:
In an inspiring setting by Lake Ammersee, we focused on the next phase of our project: deployment and implementation. Through intensive sessions, thoughtful roadmap planning, and close team coordination, we laid the foundation for a focused rollout and defined concrete next steps.

A special highlight was our hike to Andechs Abbey – a perfect blend of fresh air, great conversations, and Bavarian hospitality.

We’re feeling motivated and aligned – ready for whatever comes next.

#PrivateAIM #Retreat #Deployment #NextSteps #Teamwork #KlosterAndechs

2025.title: NUM Convention 2025
2025.content: As part of the format 'The Infrastructure NUM-DIZ: Data Privacy Seeks Researchers' at the NUM Convention 2025, Oliver Kohlbacher, as the PrivateAIM coordinator, presented how FLAME, as a funded platform within the Medical Informatics Initiative, will unlock its potential.

2024.title: Retreat in Potsdam
2024.content: Our three-day retreat in beautiful Potsdam has come to an end! Through inspiring presentations and lively discussions, we generated fresh ideas and strategies, setting key impulses for the next stages of the project. #PrivateAIM #Retreat #Teamwork

2024.title: Workshop in Leipzig
2024.content: At our two-day #PrivateAIM workshop in the venerable Albertina Library of the @UniLeipzig, the Minimal Viable Product (MVP) of the FLAME platform was presented. In various breakout sessions, topics related to the FLAME architecture were then addressed in depth, various use cases and DIZ integration were discussed and next steps were defined. Many thanks to all participants for the interesting exchange! #PrivateAIM #Workshop #Leipzig #FLAME

2023.title: Workshop in Frankfurt am Main
2023.content: To close the year, a workshop to finalize the basic architecture of the FLAME platform took place yesterday at the University Hospital in Frankfurt.

2023.title: PrivateAIM Retreat in Lobbach
2023.content: The first PrivateAIM Retreat took place in Lobbach from 16 to 18 October. This was the first face-to-face meeting of all project partners. In an atmosphere of lively dialogue and cooperation, we laid important foundations for the successful future of our project.

2023.title: Kick-Off-Meeting
2023.content: The PrivateAIM virtual kick-off meeting took place on 24 April 2023. All team members came together to initiate and plan the first phase of the project.

2023.title: Official start
2023.content: The PrivateAIM project officially started on 01.04.2023. We will report regularly on the progress of the project on this website.
